description: “John Cleland was an English author most famous and infamous for writing the controversial book “Fanny Hill”, also known as “Memoirs of a Woman of Pleasure”. In 1749, the year his book was published, Cleland and the publishers and printers of “Fanny Hill” were all arrested due to the books explicit content. The book was never legally published again for over a hundred years, although it continued to be published and sell well in pirate editions.  Now John Cleland’s book “Fanny Hill” can be appreciated openly for the powerful novel it truly is. His masterpiece is available on this application in its entirety as an audio book, read by Frances Barber.
